costmisc 0.7.7

Coerce tables to a data specification

Source: R/check_spec.R
coerce_to_spec.Rd

Coerces the columns of each data frame in table_list to the R data types defined in table_spec. Column coercion is driven by SQL-style field types and applied per table.

coerce_to_spec(table_list, table_spec, .fn_date = as.Date)

Arguments

table_list

A list of data frames to check against the spec.

table_spec

The table spec. See details.

.fn_date

Function used to coerce SQL DATETIME fields. Defaults to as.Date(), which assumes ISO-formatted dates. For Excel numeric dates, see excel_numeric_to_date.

Value

A named list of data frames with columns coerced to the types defined in table_spec.

Details

Supported SQL-to-R coercions:

  • VARCHAR → as.character()

  • LONG → integer via readr::parse_number() then as.integer()

  • INTEGER → integer via readr::parse_number() then as.integer()

  • DOUBLE → numeric via readr::parse_number()

  • BIT → as.logical()

  • BOOLEAN → as.logical()

  • DATETIME → user-supplied function (.fn_date)

See also

Other Data Spec Functions: add_missing_spec_cols(), add_missing_spec_tables(), assert_case(), change_case_from_spec(), check_spec(), data_case()
